column4: hey guys, where is the screen resolution file kept? not the xrog.conf, the resolution only changes for one user on my box and I can't see anything so I need to set it back to the right resolution.. its user specific
did you select the correct default depth and res in xorg.conf?
It works fine in 1024x768 but its all fuzzy in 800x600.. now I can't boot into x and set it back because I can't see
screen res in X is controlled by xorg.conf
it boots into gdm with 1024x768, just when I log into my account it goes into 800x600
if u want, run dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg if u feel unfomfortable fiddling with text files
oh i see..
run gnome-display-properties using sudo for a different user
sude -u <username> gnome-display-properties
above should work and fix things
gave me a Connection to ":0.0" refused by server
are you doin that from another gnome session?
yes
try gksudo -u <user> instead
? are you in a terminal with the original user?
I dont thik so
oh i may be wrong actually... maybe gnome-display-properties needs to connect
I just logged out of everything
and its still not working
gimme 1 sec
oaky dude, thanks again
if the above doesnt work... i just suggest you comment out the troublesome resolution in xorg.conf and restart X.
that way, X will revert to the default resolution
did that last thing work?
